intro: Curculigo maheensis, commonly known as Mahé’s arrowhead, is a flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands. It belongs to the family Hypoxidaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
